Description: Fragment of flattened handle at neck join of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine red-brown; cream slip. Circular stamp with rose symbol.
Production date: 143 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 143.)
Curator's comments: Ink, deleted, '339'. Name Anaxandros. Same die is used in for an example in Alexandria, Greco Roman Museum (Grace).
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (19)
